value.title: DeepMind A.I. unit lost $649 million last year and had a $1.5 billion debt waived by Alphabet
value.excerpt: DeepMind made a loss of £477 million ($649 million) in 2019, up from £470 million in 2018, according to documents filed with the U.K.'s Companies House.

value.title: Nissan builds baffling, belly-surfing GTR-X 2050 concept
value.excerpt: Nissan's design team has built a full-scale model of Korean designer Jaebum "JB" Choi's concept of an autonomous supercar for the year 2050. Conceived as a mind-controlled, rolling exoskeleton, the GTR-X is one of the year's most unusual concepts.

value.title: With AI maturing, are humans still needed to fight cybercrime?
value.excerpt: Cybercriminals are clever, and AI cannot always account for that. This is where cybersecurity and AI professionals come in.

value.title: Celtics players call for Gov. Baker to end facial recognition surveillance

value.title: India's 'invisible' women hope for recognition at farmers protests
value.excerpt: Legions of women have trekked to India's capital to join massive protests against agricultural reforms, hoping not only to protect their livelihoods but also win visibility as farmers.

value.title: From whistleblower laws to unions: How Google’s AI ethics meltdown could shape policy

value.title: Google, Apple, and others show large language models trained on public data expose personal information
value.excerpt: Researchers at Google, OpenAI, and others show that large language models including GPT-2 can reveal sensitive information.

value.title: Facebook Said It’s Developing A Tool To Read Your Brain
value.excerpt: Facebook told employees on Tuesday that it’s developing a tool to summarize news articles so users won’t have to read them. It also laid out early plans for a neural sensor to detect people’s thoughts and translate them into action.

value.title: Oscar-nominated studio Laika leans on AI to accelerate stop-motion animation
